_comment: Created by ianb on 20/03/2015 10:36:04 using v2.5
title: How has life expectancy in the UK changed by gender?
analysis_commentary: The life expectancy of both genders has generally been increasing over time. Though we often expect women to live longer than men, the gap between the genders has been narrowing. In 1982, the life expectancy of females was six years higher than males; in 2012, this has decreased to under four years.
data_source: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, Health Statistics 2014
